category: Articles of Incorporation/Article 21 (No Confidence in Executives)
contents: Article 21 (No confidence in executives) ① The general meeting may decide to partially or entirely dismiss executives. ② If all executives are dismissed pursuant to paragraph 1, the executives may be dismissed regardless of the elapse of their term of office. In case of dismissal of some executives, one full year must elapse from the date on which the relevant executives were elected. ③ The dismissal bill (the reason for requesting dismissal must be specified) is proposed with the approval of a majority of registered delegates, and is approved by the majority of registered delegates. A decision shall be made with the approval of at least two-thirds of the votes, but the relevant executive must be given an opportunity to explain his or her case prior to the decision. ④ When the dismissal proposal is approved, the relevant executive officer is immediately dismissed.
